verbs.description: besoothe (third-person singular simple present besoothes, present participle besoothing, simple past and past participle besoothed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To soothe about or all over; comfort.
examples: Attracting downward some responsive grace Or balm which heal'd him, like the hand of God: Or haply music, (like the lyre of old, Tuned into magic by the sweeping touch Of David, when he charm'd the fiend from Saul,) Besoothed the spirit; till o'er all his frame A lulling softness exquisitely crept, And he was cradled in the charm of sound.
